Intervention: Patients are vaccinated with p53-infected autologous dendritic cells subcutaneously (SC) 1 week after completion of doxorubicin and cyclophosphamide, 1 week after completion of paclitaxel (or after surgery in patients with stage III disease) and 6 and 12 weeks after completion of radiotherapy (for a total of 4 vaccinations).
• Dendritic autologous dendritic vaccine adenovirus p53: administered subcutaneously on one of the two regimens
Patients receive vaccination with autologous dendritic cells infected with p53 to 6, 8, 10 and 12 weeks after the end of radiotherapy.
• Dendritic autologous dendritic vaccine adenovirus p53: administered subcutaneously on one of the two regimens
Eligibility: Invasive breast cancer confirmed histologically meets the following criteria:
A clinically advanced disease (stage III) with a primary tumour of at least 4 cm by mammography, ultrasound or palpation AND/or palpable axillary lymph nodes of more than 1 cm
• Delayed type hypersensitivity to at least 1 out of 3 standard antigens
Bilirubine < 2 times the upper limit of normal (ULN)
No prior or concomitant autoimmune disorder
Fertile patients should use effective contraception during and for at least 6 months after participation in the study.
No other concomitant disease that would prevent participation in the study
No concurrent participation in another clinical therapeutic trial
Results: Number of participants who experienced vaccine toxicity
This outcome measure focuses on vaccine safety by documenting the number of levels 2, 3 or toxicity to participants in relation to the vaccine.
Time: 1 week after each dose of vaccine.
Title of the arm/group: Arm I

- Arm/group description: Patients receive vaccination with p53-infected autologous dendritic cells (SC) 1 week after completion of doxorubicin and cyclophosphamide, 1 week after completion of paclitaxel (or after surgery for patients with stage III disease), and 6 and 12 weeks after completion of radiotherapy (for a total of 4 vaccinations).
• Dendritic autologous dendritic vaccine adenovirus p53: administered subcutaneously on one of the two regimens
Type of measure: Number of participants
Description of the arm/group: Patients receive vaccination with autologous dendritic cells infected with p53 at 6, 8, 10 and 12 weeks after the end of radiotherapy.
• Dendritic autologous dendritic vaccine adenovirus p53: administered subcutaneously on one of the two regimens
Type of measure: Number of participants
